data.title: Sublime: 'Join Lines' command binds to Windows+J on Win 10
data.body:
while testing #16545:

On Windows 10 the 'Join Lines' command binds to Windows+J instead of Control+J. This is different from the corresponding binding in Sublime.

data.title: Do not see full path for settings.json, keybindings.json
data.body:
Testing #15808 

- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insiders a8d5b9
- OS Version: MacOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Settings (`CMD+,`)
2. Set `"window.showFullPath": true`

Result: i do not see the full path in the title bar to `settings.json`.  if i open other files in my workspace, everything seems to work properly

And, I see the same behavior for the workspace `settings.json` and `keybindings.json`, i don't see the full path in the title bar.

data.title: Launch debug widget fails to update with invalid debug config
data.body:
Testing #16494

1. Have a few debug configurations
2. Replace them all with `null`
3. Notice the debug launch widget doesn't update
4. Hit play on one of the configs

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/20923233/df052092-bbab-11e6-815a-59fc9c0fcc99.png)

NPE

data.title: Scopes are shown in hover on a function
Selection menu: Improve 'Cursor at lines end'
data.body:
Testing #16558, Linux

'Cursor at lines end' only works on a multi-line selection. Not being aware of that, I tried the action multiple times with out effect

Either:
- Disable the action if there is no multi-line selection
- Make the action also work for a single line selection

data.title: Maximum call stack size exceeded in debug
data.body:
Testing #16494

I'm not successful in reproducing this but I've seen the `Maximum call stack` error come up many times today as I experimented with the Chrome Debug extension.

The stack trace makes me think it is in our Debug world and not in the Chrome Debug extension, but I can be wrong.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/20923129/55b31556-bbab-11e6-89ce-6c78634c2fb5.png)

```
shell.ts:541Maximum call stack size exceeded: RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
    at RangeError.get stack [as stack] (native)
    at Object.l [as toErrorMessage] (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:47:1905)
    at e.onUnexpectedError (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:132:26218)
    at e.unexpectedErrorHandler (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:132:24864)
    at e.onUnexpectedError (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:30:21633)
    at Object.o [as onUnexpectedError] (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:30:19992)
    at e.invoke (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:30:23029)
    at e.fire (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:31:2192)
    at e.setFocusedStackFrame (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:84:27429)
    at t.focusStackFrameAndEvaluate (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:127:28803)
    at t.run (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:95:28401)
```

cc @roblourens

data.title: Cursors at Line Ends is confusing
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16558

The command "Selection > Cursors at Line Ends" has too many cases for where it just does nothing:
* when you do not have a selection
* when you have multiple cursors without selection
* when you have multiple cursors with selection
* when you have a selection on a single line

It only seems to work when you have a multi line selection. If that is the intent then maybe it should be renamed?

data.title: Debug widget shows process picker with a single process
data.body:
Testing #16494

1. Using `vscode-smoketest-express`, click the Debug gear icon and select the default Node.JS debug config
2. Start the `Launch Program` configuration.
3. Start the `Attach to Process` configuration. Wait for it to timeout, since there is no process to attach.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/20922741/7ab28442-bba9-11e6-81c8-334116ebe200.png)

data.title: toggle in/out of zen mode with settings.json file changes active editor
data.body:
Testing #15647 

- VSCode Version: insiders 1.8.0 a8d5b9
- OS Version: MacOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a folder
2. close all editors
3. single click on a file to open it in preview mode
4. open settings.json (CMD+,), now the editor should be replaced
5. go into zen mode (CMD+K, Z)
5. exit zen mode (CMD+K, Z)

Result: the last file you had open, before opening the settings file, is now in view. In other words, the settings file is no longer visible.  Only seems to happen with settings.json

data.title: Asymmetric behaviour of Toggle Block Comment
data.body:
while testing #16558:

Applying "Toggle Block Comment" to multiple lines adds the opening comment on the **first** line of the selection but adds the closing comment **after** the last line of the selection:

Applying "Toggle Block Comment" to this selection:
![2016-12-06_11-33-35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/20922268/d67b0dfa-bba7-11e6-8eb5-9ff6ddd40355.png)

data.title: Watermarks should automatically hide when panel opened
data.body:
Refs #16560 

Open the panel, notice how the watermarks are pushing out the logo -> looks a bit broken
Users that know how to open the panel are advanced users and we they do not need watermark help imho. Thus we could automatically hide the watermark if panel is opened.

![screen shot 2016-12-06 at 11 28 47](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/20922080/33cabbe6-bba7-11e6-9489-83a0481481d8.png)

data.title: highlight C++ code failed in one file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:06:37.428Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.5|
|java-debug|DSnake|0.0.2|

|java|redhat|0.0.7|
|Spell|seanmcbreen|0.9.1|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.2.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. just open a cpp file, the file generated by protobuffer, from line 1106, there is no more colors for any token
I have close the file and reopen it, while the issue is still there.

It would be good if I can terminate the program from Call stack

data.title: Commands in debug widget gets hidden
data.body:
Testing #16026

Have the following compound configuration in [launch.json](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/master/.vscode/launch.json) in VSCode repo

```
"compounds": [
		{
			"name": "Debug VSCode",
			"configurations": [
				"Launch VSCode",
				"Attach to Extension Host"
			]
		}
	]
```

- Start the above compound config
- Switch between two configurations in the launch widget

This will mess up the widget and there is no way to terminate it.

This could be related/similar to the issue #16596

data.title: Watermark actions should be clickable
data.body:
Refs #16560

What is the reason that watermark actions are not clickable? They would just execute the corresponding keybinding. Watermark actions are taking a huge part of the screen and when a user sees something like that he clicks on that IMHO.

data.title: Zoom in Zen mode brings back status bar, activity bar
data.body:
Testing #15647

OSX
1.8.0-insiders 
commit: a8d5

To repro:
- turn on zen mode (CMD+K, Z)
- zoom in or out (CMD++ or CMD+-)

result: activity bar and status bar reappear!

data.title: insert final new line should also trim additional lines
data.body:
* have a file with 10 final new lines
* save with the setting enabled
* you still have 10 lines, should only be one

data.title: Consider to rearrange sections in Selection menu
data.body:
while testing #16558:

I suggest to sort the groups in the "Selection" menu by usage frequency/importance.
My proposal:
1. "Select All" group
1. "Copy Line Up" group
1. merge "Add Cursor above" and "Add next occurrences" group

Since both the "Add Cursor above" and the "Add next occurrences" group deal with multi cursors I would put them into one group

data.title: Debug widget has some UI issues
data.body:
Testing #16026

Clone the [vscode-smoketest-express](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-smoketest-express) repo and checkout the `chrome-debug` branch.

Make sure Chrome is running in your machine **without** the `--debug` flag. We want the Chrome debugger to fail further ahead.

1. Put breakpoints in `routes/index.js:6` and `public/script.js:5`.
2. In debug viewlet, start `Server`.
3. In debug viewlet, start `Chrome`. Do not press Continue once the debugger breaks.
4. After 10 seconds, the Chrome debugger will timeout.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/20920491/6d270324-bba0-11e6-8ac8-8f8282496401.png)

5. Dismiss the error messages.
6. Hit Play. Notice the widget:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/20920536/9e2e8bb8-bba0-11e6-9aa7-9338c5186dbc.png)

6. Refresh the browser. It should hit a server breakpoint. Notice the widget:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/20921604/3de60dee-bba5-11e6-93ec-06c8d96774e8.png)

---

I somehow also was able to get it stuck in this state, while playing around... No steps for this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/20921544/edbde652-bba4-11e6-9a29-3228160e4c3f.png)

data.title: Way to easily dismiss watermarks
data.body:
Refs #16560

There should be a way to easily dismiss the watermark. Optimally this would be a setting
'workbench.tips.visible', and there would be an explicit action on the start screen which would flip this setting.

The users which would appreciate this:
* expert users that do not need help and like the clean UX that vscode is known for
* users that have already read through all the watermark tips we give them
